name: count-step3
description: Count in 3 steps. The speed is the most comfortable.

name: count-step5
description: Count in 5 steps.

name: count-step10
description: Count in 10 steps. The speed is too fast.

name: sum4-oneByOne
description: It looks like stacking up the values with synchronizing the axis change.

name: sum
description: Shifting right and left seem unnecessary/not intuitive.

name: sum-oneByOne
description: Points are too crowded to see individually right after the y-axis changes.

name: sum-oneByOne-delayedDisappear
description: Points are too crowded to see individually right after the y-axis changes.

name: sum2-oneByOne
description: When the sum is large, the points are too closed to zero after the axis changes.

name: sum2-step
description: When the sum is large, the points are too closed to zero after the axis changes.

name: sum2-atOnce
description: When the sum is large, the points are too closed to zero after the axis changes.

name: sum4-atOnce
description: It's not look much like stacking points.

name: sum4-step
description: It looks like stacking points but the y-axis is not synced with the stacked up value. Even if it is synced, the speed of the axis change will be too fast.

name: max
description: It is strightforward to be recognized.

name: min
description: It is strightforward to be recognized.

name: avg3
description: Shows each individual contribution. It seems like the residues are cancelled out.

name: avg-gooey
description: We hope that the gooey metaphor shows the center of the mass of each group, but it seems not strightforward.

name: avg4
description: It's unclear why the points are moved vertically.

name: avg5
description: It seems unnecessary to show the gray vertical heights.

name: median-new9
description: It's more clear that the points are bisected.

name: median
description: It's unclear why the points disappear at each end.

name: median-new4
description: '50%' can be ambiguous. It's not visual cue.

name: median-new5
description: Bisecting lines are not clear what they mean. Different horrizontal offsets per points seems unnecessary.

name: median-new6
description: Bisecting lines are not clear what they mean. Different horrizontal offsets per points seems unnecessary.

name: median-new7
description: It explains that the points are bisected but seems too verbose.

name: median-new8
description: Unclear that pairs of point at the ends are counted to be bisected.

name: median-new10
description: It explains that the points are bisected but seems too verbose.

name: median-new11
description: It explains that the points are bisected but seems too verbose.

name: stdev4-mirroring
description: The bottom halves appears later to ensure that they have the same heights.

name: stdev3
description: The horizontal spanning seems unnecessary.

name: stdev4
description: It's simpler than the selected one but less gurantees the halves are the same.

name: stdev5
description: Each residue seems contribute to be stdev error bars, but its calculation is incorrect.

name: stdev6
description: It adds the squares of the residues and get the square of it. However, it exceeds the y-axis range.

name: stdev7
description: Each residue seems contribute to be stdev error bars, but its calculation is incorrect.

name: iqr9
description: It is consistent with the median animation. Looks like counting to ensure that each of four groups have the same number of the points.

name: iqr2
description: Too many labels in a short period.

name: iqr2-noText
description: The meaning of colors and the rising lines are insufficiently clear.

name: iqr3
description: It tries to convey that there are the same number of the inner points and the outer points. However, the visual explanation seems verbose.

name: iqr4
description: Counting is unclear as the points can be overlapped.

name: iqr5
description: Different horrizontal offsets seem unnecessary. The meaning of the four groups are not clear.

name: iqr6
description: Too verbose and unclear what it wants to convey.

name: iqr7
description: It nested the median animation but seems too fast.
